newsitem.title: MEXICO: Delay selling off Mexico petrochemical said costly.
newsitem.headline: Delay selling off Mexico petrochemical said costly.

text.p: The delay in privatizing Mexico's petrochemical industry has postponed investments worth about $8.0 billion, Minister of Energy Jesus Reyes Heroles told the Mexican Congress on Tuesday.
"There is a large list of petrochemical projects that are outstanding, waiting for this (the privatization) to work itself out before they start," Reyes Heroles said.
"We are talking about interesting amounts...about $2.0 billion in one group, about $6.0 billion in another," he said.
The Mexican government is working out how it will privatize the secondary petrochemical sector.
"There are a series of important industrial projects that depend on resolving the selling off of the secondary petrochemical sector," he said.
Reyes Heroles said he hoped there would be advances made in the process before the end of the year.
